page.title: 19ENTERTAINMENT IN DALRY(KIRK)
page.content: Dalry is used to making its own entertainment, though the advent of T.V,.at present available on three channels with a fourth one promised soon, and Videos has considerably reduced the popularity of dances and whist drives.Discos held in the Town Hall are popular with the young folk and attract youth from outside the area.An enthusiastic drama group presents an annual pantomime which is full of local colour.Occasionally they do a one act play or a revue to raise money for a special cause.There is an annual parish social and throughout the year there are a series of Coffee Mornings and 'Teas' to raise money for charities The Music Club,subsidised by the Scottish Arts Council,each year organise four concerts of classical music performed by professional musicians.
